PROCEDURE WHEN THERE IS NO PROPERTY OR ONLY MOVABLE PROPERTY
(1) If, in accordance with the information in the coroner's certificate, the deceased has left no property, the probate court shall decide not to carry out a probate hearing.
(2) This shall also be the procedure when the deceased leaves only movable property and none of those entitled to inherit requests a hearing.
(3) When the court decides that it shall not carry out a probate hearing, it must notify the competent social services centre thereof if among the heirs there are persons who are not capable of taking care of their affairs and who have no parents.
(4) If the court decides that it shall not carry out a probate hearing due to the fact that the estate consists only of movable property, persons who are entitled to inherit may enforce their legitimate rights as heirs.
